title: @RiotScruffy considering the talk about an update for immobile mages,and zyra in specific
body:
Are there plans to move her back to mid lane?
Make her more of a support?
Keep things more or less the same?
Try and make her equally good at both roles?
Undecided/Unclear yet?

I think some of us are very curious as to what your plans for zyra are,considering she is in such an odd spot.

replies.body:
My gut tells me that we would probably target more or less the same. Strong/viable in support role with an option for mid as a not top tier but fun side option. We don't have any specific plans with her right now, but that is how I'd feel when we started that conversation. 

Does this sit right with you guys?

No, please, aim for midlane.

She was intended to be a mid laner, not support. If a champion adapts to another role that it wasn't intended, for instance. Let's say, people play an adc as a tank(not including urgot), and does well. But yet, said champion is in an awkward spot(Such as Zyra is), so you decide to rework them. Would you want to rework them into a tank due to it working well? Or would you keep it intended for adc's?

Please, let it be the other way around. **Let mid zyra be the focus while support Zyra gets the fun side option.**

Cool, glad I asked. IMO we can aim for a good at both option like a lot of our Top/Jung champs or some of the ADC/Mids that work well. If there's strong support for mid Zyra, no reason to not support it.

> [{quoted}](name=RiotScruffy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bnsq5Xwv,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2015-08-19T04:28:03.371+0000)
>
> Cool, glad I asked. IMO we can aim for a good at both option like a lot of our Top/Jung champs or some of the ADC/Mids that work well. If there's strong support for mid Zyra, no reason to not support it.

My opinion:  Zyra is Annie, in terms of lane and role.

It's great if she's good at support, but if she's not good in mid lane, we've got a problem.
Good analogy. I concur.

> [{quoted}](name=RiotScruffy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bnsq5Xwv,comment-id=00030000000000010000,timestamp=2015-08-19T05:56:02.510+0000)
>
> Good analogy. I concur.

Jumping in to agree 100%. When i was first starting out in League, i would play literally everything as a support because i sucked at farming. One of the things that's fun about playing characters like Annie/Zyra/Lux as supports is BECAUSE they are designed to be mid laners. Sure they aren't as good at supporty stuff as people like Nami, but they do damage and they're like a soft-ish 'kill lane' compared to other standard bot compositions. 

Zyra has the potential to be a super cool zone control mage much the same way champs like Azir and Orianna work. In fact, you might even say that with her plant minions, Zyra was basically doing the Azir thing long before Azir was. Please retain and support this aspect of who she is - it would suck to see her turned into a utility focused support character and lose her awesome sustained damage profile.

Why don't we all take a moment to realize that support Vel'kox is also more highly picked than mid lane Vel'koz because of his immobility. All of these high class mages who can't keep up with the dashy flashy mid laners are getting shuffled down to bot lane. And it's really pathetic!

Well a reason why a lot of the immobile mages are picked as support is because...
Well a lot of the immobile mages get CC and base damages in return for having no mobility... and well supports do work rather well with high base damages and CC
See, this is why I'm glad Riot talks with their fans before jumping on changes and reworks. This needs to be the rule, not the exception.

> [{quoted}](name=RiotScruffy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bnsq5Xwv,comment-id=00030000000000010000,timestamp=2015-08-19T05:56:02.510+0000)
>
> Good analogy. I concur.

Semi-related: this is the type of champ I like learning in the support role where I don't need to worry about cs and then moving mid with.

Thank you Scruffy.

As a Mid Zyra Main, I'm relieved haha.

I definitely think aiming for a good mid/support is what should be done for her. I personally main her in mid and occasionally take her in the support role.

Why purposefully eliminate a part of her player base?

Suggestions for change:

* Add some MS. She is one of the slowest champions in the game. I mean we get it, she's a plant, but this is a little much.

*  Tinker with her passive. I think her passive is decent the way it stands now, but I'm sure something more interesting could be done with it. 
*  More plants! Allow her W to spread its roots after it's been planted for X amount of time and sprout an additional bud randomly within a limited range. Would make her w more interesting instead of just a means to an end and would also give zyra more plants
* I really would like her to be able to set up a "base" of sorts. Her plants should be able to thrive in the jungle thematically, so why can't she do more with them?

She doesn't really feel like the Rise of the Thorns with only two plants under her control. Right now she is just another combo control mage that has some dots from her plants. I think there are many cool things that could be done with her character that are not being taken advantage of.

Has anyone looked into buffs specifically for Jungle Zyra? In theory, her kit should allow her to fill the role rather nicely, mostly counterganking and farming up for the mid-late game damages, while providing good utility for her team, at the cost of mobility and survivability. She's currently one of only a few true mages who can jungle, the others being Fiddlesticks (who is really bad right now), Karma (who is kind of amazing), and maybe Morgana. The other AP junglers are mostly assassins like nidalee and diana.

While in theory her kit SHOULD allow for good jungling, particularly with the free "wards" her W provides, her early clear is just too horrible to get away with unless the enemy jungler is woefully incompetent. Would it be too much to ask for her to get something of a "nidalee treatment", with specific interactions with jungle camps to help her early clear (first clear and the ones before getting Runeglaive)?

Also on the subject of Runeglaive, it REALLY is suboptimal for true mage junglers (hence why no one plays fiddlesticks anymore). Runeglaive is really good for some junglers, but could we get another alternative for actual mages soon? Is there a reason there can only be 5 jungle items and no two that scale with the same stat that offer different power curves (early pressure vs late carry)?

Not everyone agrees with my brother Shadow up there. 

Back when I was still a scrub with all champions, I played a bit of Zyra. I don't know why, her kit just clicked with me. 
I played her mid a lot after that, but now have brought her down into the support role to the point that I main support with her. 

The thing is, I LOVE her as a support. Unless you added a cool movement mechanic like Zyra teleporting to her seeds/plants, I wouldn't want to play her mid.

Damagey supports like Zyra, Xerath, Velkoz, Brand, and Annie, are cool (maybe the last too aren't). I hope the immobile mage changes don't remove why those champs were fun to play in a support role. 

I am not saying don't give her the tools to play mid. I'm asking give her the ability to play both.

> [{quoted}](name=RiotScruffy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bnsq5Xwv,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2015-08-19T04:28:03.371+0000)
>
> Cool, glad I asked. IMO we can aim for a good at both option like a lot of our Top/Jung champs or some of the ADC/Mids that work well. If there's strong support for mid Zyra, no reason to not support it.

just throwing my opinion in but she needs to be a mid laner dont ruin her for me just dont do it man

> [{quoted}](name=RiotScruffy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bnsq5Xwv,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2015-08-19T04:28:03.371+0000)
>
> Cool, glad I asked. IMO we can aim for a good at both option like a lot of our Top/Jung champs or some of the ADC/Mids that work well. If there's strong support for mid Zyra, no reason to not support it.

you know immoble mages have one of the high rates in the game right?

annie morgana lux. thats al i need to say on that... I believe 2 of 3 of them are meant to be mid.. and work as intended mid.. but work great as support.. zyra is sub-par at both.. but that is kind of because plant ai is very weird.. maybe could use some type of ALT+button control.. something.. and her passive..

Have to agree, and this is coming from a player that plays 90% support characters, Zyra should be a mage.  And while you're at it, she needs a new passive, that is a tank passive (and not a particularly fulfilling one) which is the one thing she shouldn't be.  Give her some kind of lifesteal passive for example, she is supposed to be a carnivorous plant after all, ya' can't say it doesn't fit.
What is Riot's obsession with forcing Zyra into being a support?

> [{quoted}](name=RiotScruffy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bnsq5Xwv,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-08-19T04:17:31.301+0000)
>
> My gut tells me that we would probably target more or less the same. Strong/viable in support role with an option for mid as a not top tier but fun side option. We don't have any specific plans with her right now, but that is how I'd feel when we started that conversation. 
> 
> Does this sit right with you guys?

No. It doesn't sit right with me at all at all. She was designed to be a mid lane mage, and I hate it when I see mid lane mages as a support (looking at _YOU_ {{champion:25}}  and {{champion:1}})

I mean, I'm a jungle main, but my secondary role is mid. And do you know who's my favorite mid-laner whom I can't play because of Riot's decisions with her in the past?

Zyra

> [{quoted}](name=Auryiel,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bnsq5Xwv,comment-id=00030004,timestamp=2015-08-19T04:54:49.076+0000)
>
> What is Riot's obsession with forcing Zyra into being a support?

Maybe it's Riot's way of saying "screw you" to CertainlyT? Like, I haven't seen any of his other champions be nerfed into the ground in their original designed role and be forced into another role aside from Zyra.
To be fair Morg was designed as a support (the class not the role, the role didn't exist at the time) and was latter picked up by players as a mage in the mid lane.

> [{quoted}](name=LankPants,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bnsq5Xwv,comment-id=0003000400000000,timestamp=2015-08-19T06:57:07.883+0000)
>
> To be fair Morg was designed as a support (the class not the role, the role didn't exist at the time) and was latter picked up by players as a mage in the mid lane.


Morgana   –  _Fallen Angel_
Primary Role: Mage
Secondary Role: Support

That's from her in-client information. Morgana is a Mid-lane mage, with support as her _SECONDARY_ role

Same thing with Zyra

Zyra   –  _Rise of the Thorns_
Primary Role: Mage
Secondary Role: Support

They're mid-lane mages first, supports second.

Those tags only came about in around season 3, by which time Morg was an established mid lanner. If you go and look at pre S1 info people will refer to Morg as a support character because that was her original design.

> [{quoted}](name=BlackSunNocturne,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bnsq5Xwv,comment-id=000300040000,timestamp=2015-08-19T05:20:13.742+0000)
>

> Maybe it's Riot's way of saying "screw you" to CertainlyT? 

Pretty sure certainlyT was the guy behind the nerfs,I'm guessing the proccess was: "Hmm,this champion isn't retarded enough for me to be associated with it,I'm going to nerf it to the point people forget it exists".

> [{quoted}](name=Auryiel,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bnsq5Xwv,comment-id=00030004,timestamp=2015-08-19T04:54:49.076+0000)
>
> What is Riot's obsession with forcing Zyra into being a support?

I 'm more curious about mordekaiser being the ADC...
I've given up on Morde tbh

Can I ask a question on the design philosophy side of things, which may in turn help target what Zyra may need? Full disclaimer, I love Zyra, and would absolutely love to see her midlane again. 

When I asked about Riot's opinion about Sion, you said you felt that he was balance number-wise, and his winrates were reasonable. On champion.gg Zyra and Sion both have two role entries. Both have very close play and winrates. Sion Top has 51.12% win and 1.73% play with Zyra sup being at 51.84% win with 1.54% played. Their off roles are 48.37%/.44% and 49.77%/.51% respectively. 

So considering the performance, I think the best way to start is asking what is it about her play that makes Zyra feel weak, when her performance is in line with a champion that feels appropriate?

Personally I hate her W for the fact that there's no reason to upgrade it. If it gave her plants extra health for upgrading it, that would be really cool.

I know others don't like her passive, and would like to see that changed. The best idea I heard for a new passive was one that would help her Solo lane without really affecting her Support power too much. Make her passive spawn plants when she last hit's a minion with an ability. Melee minions spawn short ranged plants when killed and casters spawn ranged plants.
her w gives cdr mate. tbh i find maxing it pretty effective at times.. depends on the lane match-up i guess
If you max W you lose all of the Q and E damage and root duration, not to mention a shorter Q CD anyway. It's never worth the 2% CDR you gain.

2% at level 1. 10% maxed. and the plants gain damage on your level as well. ill give you the root duration, but the q damage is a bit better for the poke. so i do max it second, (or first if i decide to max w last [as i said depends on the match ups]). I find the root duration is nice but more.. game changing and needed towards later game.. maybe its just me, I play her a lot of different ways. experimentation.

If you rank your Q the CD's shorter than if you max W anyway. The CD on Q drops from 7 to 5, which is equivalent to around 30% CDR.

The damage on plants also scales with champ level, not skill level.

There's very little reason to skill W, all you gain per rank is 1.3 sec less CD per seed and 2% CDR. If you rank Q you get 45 damage and 0.5 seconds of CD and if you max E you get 35 damage and 0.25 seconds of snare.

There's also no point having CDR if your abilities are low impact anyway.

Honestly, I think she makes more sense as a mage than a support, from a pure thematics standpoint. I'd like more focus on her plants, instead of now where they're mostly a side thing (either pure burst from E-Q-R with the occasional plant damage as a mage, or entirely focused on her good bases and E as a support.)

Definitely mid lane focus, with a not top tier but fun support option. She was designed to be a mage, she got nerfed, then she started shining as a support, and got nerfed again as a result of her not being able to compete in mid fairly. Right now, her core problems imo would be her range when considering her speed, on top of her abysmal mana costs and a lackluster, unsatisfying passive. In my opinion, anyway.

We don't have a lot of poke supports, Zyra is one of them, with Lux, Lulu and Fiddle running up since Annie's had a bit of reworking over the last while. I prefer having Zyra as a support to have a larger pool of champs to take bot lane. There's something really satisfying taking Zyra against a Blitzcrank and watching him pull your plants xD
Bigger playerbase as a support,so work on her should be focused on her as a support.
With that thought process might as well reduce annie's abilites.

> [{quoted}](name=Dissith Bullets,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bnsq5Xwv,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-08-18T19:21:18.364+0000)
>
> With that thought process might as well reduce annie's abilites.

Uh,bigger playerbase in the mid lane?

So yeah,annie's balancing should focus on her mid lane.
Lol agreed.

whats the problem with Zyra?
whenever i see one she usually fares well

whats wrong with her? she was god on release got nerfed and people have this very "its either broken op or useless" and because zyra wasnt in the "broken op" with the 70% winrate she was classed as useless but then again she has the 2nd highest level 6 burst of any mid laner being only compairable to veigar. (annie is close 3rd)

> [{quoted}](name=Nekusen,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bnsq5Xwv,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-08-18T20:28:44.547+0000)
>
> whats the problem with Zyra?

A big discrepancy between winrate and how strong she is perceived by people(ergo her popularity),same as sona.
Can give you 20 guesses as to why it is that way,but most of them claim: "she actually is bad and misrepresented by her winrate"

> whenever i see one she usually fares well

People often forget that when you see something as rarely seen as zyra,it's not played by the same people who play mainstream picks,they are generally much more dedicated than them,which can give an illusion of a champion being stronger than he actually is.

Also people see it so rarely they forgot how to punish it,or just don't bother with it.

Zyra is one of my highest win rate champions. I mainly play her as mid but sometimes play her as support. The only thing I dislike is that her plants are retarded and her passive is just bad. There will be multiple targets within the plants range, but they just won't attack sometimes. The delay on her passive lets people walk out of range before you can fire it. Also, it isn't anywhere near as terrifying as when a Karthus or a Sion dies. Most people will just stand next to you when you die as Zyra because her passive just sucks. A lot of people say Zyra has mana problems, but I have no problem managing my mana. The delay on her Q isn't anywhere near as bad as people make it out to be. I believe the slow travel speed on her E is justified because it can travel through units.

Last time a red said anything about what exactly they wanted to do with her, they said they wanted to make her more plant-based. The way Riot designs champions a lot nowadays, they'll probably focus more on making her kit thematically satisfying than on making it suited specifically mid or bot (though her type of champ often has some level of viability in both).

> [{quoted}](name=TemporalDonut,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bnsq5Xwv,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-08-18T20:53:11.703+0000)
>
> Last time a red said anything about what exactly they wanted to do with her, they said they wanted to make her more plant-based. The way Riot designs champions a lot nowadays, they'll probably focus more on making her kit thematically satisfying than on making it suited specifically mid or bot (though her type of champ often has some level of viability in both).

Well her damage is more tied to her mid lane,her cc more tied to her as a support.

Making her more plant based(unless you want to give them cc)=moving her more towards the mid lane=going against the majority of her playerbase.

I mean sure it didn't really bother them with morde,but still.
majority.. you mean the ones that play her as support because playing her in mid is not as good as it could be and want to play her in her current optimal role?

> [{quoted}](name=miseryvein,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bnsq5Xwv,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2015-08-19T08:45:35.421+0000)
>
> majority.. you mean the ones that play her as support because playing her in mid is not as good as it could be and want to play her in her current optimal role?

No,I mean the majority of the people playing her.

Look,people in this game just don't roll this way,a mid laner isn't going to play support zyra because she's better there,either he plays mid zyra,or he plays a different mid laner mid.

The vast majority of people who play support zyra are support mains,you can easily see that if you look for random zyra games in lolking(under replays).

maybe, but ik most of the people i talk to that own and play zyra. would rather play her in mid but shes out classed. including me, i wanted to work with it but, supp just ends up.. better.. so to say, and im not very good at support in comparison to mid. (besides maybe with nami which i have more luck with HER mid than zyra)

> [{quoted}](name=miseryvein,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bnsq5Xwv,comment-id=00020000000000000000,timestamp=2015-08-19T11:03:10.905+0000)
>
> maybe, but ik most of the people i talk to that own and play zyra. would rather play her in mid but shes out classed. 

Well most of the people I know want to play her as support,but she is pretty worthless there as well.

>including me, i wanted to work with it but, supp just ends up.. better.. so to say, and im not very good at support in comparison to mid. (besides maybe with nami which i have more luck with HER mid than zyra)

I don't even see why,she has more or less the same issues as a mid laner as a support,with similar strengths.

I mean it's true that zyra's weaknesses are more crippling in the mid lane,but if you expect your opponents to punish your weaknesses,you straight up avoid the zyra pick,she has massive holes in her kit.
but also by your logic. wouldnt a mid laner that would want to play zyra prefer her to be viable there to pick her up. not just for fun there. for being viable there.

> [{quoted}](name=miseryvein,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bnsq5Xwv,comment-id=00020000000000000001,timestamp=2015-08-19T11:04:34.429+0000)
>
> but also by your logic. wouldnt a mid laner that would want to play zyra prefer her to be viable there to pick her up. not just for fun there. for being viable there.

Yes?
What are you getting at?
